CHAT.comment: spelling out of names occurs , including last name
Dea rrsanta Ea Wuou willsee thea big tiger Dawna house

Chi loses track of her ideas easily and has trouble focusing. Mot suggests writing to Santa so Chi writes this out. Mot takes the pen from Chi to show her how to write the r in dear. Chi says that she wants to ask Santa for a doll with magic jewels but this is never written. Chi then decides to write to Erin Callahan (Chi's teacher) but doesn't finish her name. Next Chi writes <you will see the tiger> in which she can more or less write the first words herself , and Mot coaches her for writing tiger. Later she goes back and adds in word big by covering over some of the word tiger. Mot tells Chi to write her first and last name which Chi is able to do on her own. Chi wants to write in pen which is a big mistake because Chi's hand+writing is poor. Mot helps Chi spell some words which at times Chi resists and others accepts. Chi and Mot raise their voices to each other during the activity. Chi is not asked to read the letter back.

u.a: Chi's e is as tall as the d
takes pencil and writes for Chi
Chi writes k over the r
touches Chi's eye trying to indicate the letter i
in writing big , Chi is covering tiger
raises hand , shakes finger at Chi
